abstract: The four biggest brokerage companies still dominate the U.S. wealth management space, but independent and regional firms are catching up as they gained clients and assets after the 2008 downturn, Reuters reported.
snippet: The four biggest brokerage companies still dominate the U.S. wealth management space, but independent and regional firms are catching up as they gained clients and assets after the 2008 downturn, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: The four biggest brokerage companies dominate the American wealth management space, but independent and regional firms have been catching up since they gained clients and assets after the 2008 downturn, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Big Brokerages Lost Market Share, Study Finds

abstract: Worries about the effect of government efforts to strengthen oversight of banks faded somewhat on Monday, helping Wall Street indexes to end the day mostly higher.
snippet: Worries about the effect of government efforts to strengthen oversight of banks faded somewhat on Monday, helping Wall Street indexes to end the day mostly higher.
lead_paragraph: Worries about the effect of government efforts to strengthen oversight of banks faded somewhat on Monday, helping Wall Street indexes to end the day mostly higher.

headline.main: Drop in Commodity Prices Pushes Indexes Down
